term_definition: An economic principle stating that taxes should be levied according to an individual's capacity to pay.
why_it_matters: Promotes fairness in taxation and supports progressive tax systems.
term_example: Higher-income individuals pay higher income tax rates, while lower-income individuals pay less.

term_definition: Taxes should be levied in proportion to the benefits received.
why_it_matters: Aligns tax payments with public service usage.
term_example: Fuel taxes fund road construction; drivers who use roads more pay more.
